Detailed Description

FrameController is designed to block out an area on the screen to display a single item.

Generally, FrameController should be used to hold a single child widget item, because it can be difficult to organize child widget in a way that's scalable to different screen sizes without the children overlapping each other. You can, however, add multiple children to a FrameController and control their position within the FrameController by assigning gravity to each child, using the setGravity().

 FrameController* fl = new FrameController(this);
 TextWidget* tw = new TextWidget(this);
 tw->setText("Hello World");
 FrameControllerParams* flp = new FrameControllerParams(
     ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT, ControllerParams::WRAP_CONTENT);
 fl->addWidget(tw, flp);

Member Function Documentation

gaia::graphics::Drawer* gaia::ui::FrameController::getForeground ( )

The foreground drawable, if non-null, is always drawn on top of the children.

Returns the drawable used as the foreground of this FrameController.

void gaia::ui::FrameController::setForeground ( gaia::graphics::Drawer *  drawer)

Any padding in the Drawable will be taken into account by ensuring that the children are inset to be placed inside of the padding area.

Supply a Drawable that is to be rendered on top of all of the child views in the frame layout.

void gaia::ui::FrameController::setForegroundGravity ( int32_t  foregroundGravity)

Describes how the foreground is positioned.

Defaults to START and TOP.

void gaia::ui::FrameController::setMeasureAllChildren ( bool  measureAll)

Determines whether to measure all children or just those in the VISIBLE or INVISIBLE state when measuring.

Defaults to false.
